label: 二藍
本: A Tale of Flowering Fortunes:  Annals of Japanese Aristocratic Life in the Heian Period (Volumes One and Two) . Stanford University Press . 1980
説明文: Double indigo was the name used for a range of colors shading from pale violet to deep purplish-blue.  The darker shades, in particular, were associated with summer wear  (p. 665). [HW]"
